p:
Hepatitis B vaccination was introduced in Bangladesh in phases during 2003–05 under the Expanded Program on Immunization
280 and since 2007, more than 95% of infants younger than 1 year have been vaccinated against HBV.
281 The coverage in 2016 was reported to be as high as 97% by WHO and UNICEF. HBV prevalence appears to have declined in Bangladesh, from 5·5% in 2008 and from 6·4% in 1997 to 0·7% in 2010. 58, 59
